title: Human Flesh
summary: On top of watching his dysfunctional family crumble around him, Bob faces the wrath of a jealous health inspector who cooks up a nasty rumor about the restaurant's choice of meat.

title: Crawl Space
summary: His in-laws are coming into town, and Bob tries desperately to concoct a plan to avoid them for as long as he can. Unfortunately, Bob did not plan to get stuck in the recesses of the family restaurant.

title: Sacred Cow
summary: A filmmaker placed a cow outside the restaurant to make a statement, which angers Bob, but his family is confused over how he treats the cow.

title: Sexy Dance Fighting
summary: When Tina develops a crush on the new martial arts instructor in town, she joins the class and ends up shirking her responsibilities at the restaurant. Bob finds out what's going on and decides to take matters into his own hands.

title: Hamburger Dinner Theater
summary: Linda is dying to relive her dream of becoming a star on Broadway, so she decides to host a dinner theater at the restaurant. But on opening night a shocking surprise leaves Linda with a more chilling production than she planned for.

title: Sheesh! Cab, Bob?
summary: Bob takes a second job as a nighttime cab driver so he can give Tina the 13th birthday party she deserves, and he makes some surprising new friends along the ride.

title: Bed & Breakfast
summary: Linda gets really excited about opening a Bed and Breakfast to capitalize on the high volume of tourists coming into town, but when the guests start to arrive Louise senses espionage afoot.

title: Art Crawl
summary: Linda's eccentric sister Gayle comes to town intending to use the restaurant as a gallery for her paintings during this year's "Art Crawl." Bob is left totally oblivious the comically explicit nature of Gayle's artwork until it's too late.

title: Spaghetti Western and Meatballs
summary: Bob and Gene bond over spaghetti western movies, which makes Louise jealous.

title: Burger War
summary: Bob's landlord has been understanding about the consistent delay in rent, but payment time has come. After getting wind of Bob's financial trouble, Jimmy Pesto faces-off against his mortal enemy by introducing burgers to his own menu.

title: Weekend at Mort's
summary: The family has to stay next door at Mort the Mortician's house since the restaurant is infested with mold. Bob and Linda double date with Mort and his mysterious Internet-girlfriend; while Tina entertains her siblings in the crematorium.

title: Lobsterfest
summary: Bob is likely the only person in town excited about the cancellation of this years "Lobsterfest" due to inclement weather. Bob strikes gold when he opens the restaurant regardless of the storm, and is celebrated by the masses.

title: Torpedo
summary: Bob is giddy as ever when his role model, minor league pitcher Torpedo Jones, gives a shout-out to the restaurant during a game, but is blind-sided upon finding out Torpedo endorses his burgers for reasons which are morally shaky at best.

title: The Belchies
summary: The kids hunt for treasure in an abandoned taffy factory and Bob and Linda must find them before the factory's scheduled demolition.

title: Bob Day Afternoon
summary: A bank robber holds up a bank across the street from Bob's Burgers. When the robbery goes awry, Bob finds himself at the center of a hostage crisis.

title: Synchronized Swimming
summary: The Belcher children sign up for an independent study of synchronized swimming in lieu on participating in gym class. Linda disturbingly watches "pregnant yoga" and comes to the rescue of her children in the end.

title: Burgerboss
summary: Bob becomes a gamer.

title: Food Truckin'
summary: Bob gives the food truck business a try.

title: Dr. Yap
summary: When a drugged Bob kisses Gayle thinking she's Linda, Gayle develops a crush on him.

title: Moody Foodie
summary: A bad review leads to drastic actions.

title: Bad Tina
summary: Tina pals around with a bad girl.

title: Beefsquatch
summary: Bob gets thrilled when he gets offered to be in a cookery segment in a local morning show. When Gene steps into the limelight, the audience is not entertained and enthralled by Bob's performance.

title: Ear-Sy Rider
summary: While a biker gang begins hanging out at the restaurant, Louise goes through a crisis after a teenager steals her bunny ear hat.

title: Full Bars
summary: On Halloween, the kids run into bullies when they go trick-or-treating in the rich neighborhood, while Bob and Linda attend a party where someone kills Teddy's pet guinea pig.

title: Bob Fires the Kids
summary: Fearing that he is ruining their childhoods, Bob fires the kids from their jobs at the restaurant, but they just end up working for hippies who run a marijuana farm, instead.

title: Mutiny on the Windbreaker
summary: Bob brings the family along when he is hired to be a chef on a docked cruise ship, so they can see his skills outside the restaurant.

title: An Indecent Thanksgiving Proposal
summary: In order to entice an old flame who is only attracted to married men, Mr. Fischoeder bribes Bob into letting him pass off Linda and the kids as his own family, but the situation ruins all of Bob's Thanksgiving traditions.

title: The Deepening
summary: Mr. Fischoeder buys a mechanical movie shark as an attraction for his amusement park, but the kids accidentally let it loose on the town, forcing Bob and Teddy to save the day.

title: Tina-Rannosaurus Wrecks
summary: Tina is wracked with guilt when Bob forces her to lie about an accident that occurred when he let her drive his car, but a shady insurance adjuster sees through their ploy and blackmails Bob into committing more insurance fraud.

title: The Unbearable Like-Likeness of Gene
summary: An incredibly annoying girl develops a crush on Gene, but he can't bring himself to dump her after he finds out her father has a music studio in their home.

title: Bob Rest Ye Merry Gentle-Mannequins
summary: 'Tis the season for strange holiday mannequins.

title: Mother Daughter Laser Razor
summary: Linda struggles to connect with Louise when they attend a mother-daughter seminar, while Bob takes Tina to get her legs waxed.

title: Nude Beach
summary: It's dingles and dongles and birthday suits.

title: Broadcast Wagstaff School News
summary: Tina is on a mission to unmask the middle school and Gene decides to dress up like Bob

title: My Fuzzy Valentine
summary: Bob gets romantic.

title: Lindapendent Woman
summary: Linda quits the restaurant and takes up a job at a grocery store.

title: O.T.: The Outside Toilet
summary: Eugene encounters a mysterious talking toilet.

title: Topsy
summary: The Belcher kids take on a Thomas Edison fanatic.

title: Two for Tina
summary: Tina finds herself in a love triangle.

title: It Snakes a Village
summary: Bob and the family take a swinging vacation.

title: Family Fracas
summary: The Belchers appear on a television game show.

title: The Kids Run the Restaurant
summary: When Linda takes Bob to the hospital after cutting his finger, the kids turn the basement into an underground casino.

title: Boyz 4 Now
summary: Louise is horrified when she develops her first crush.

title: Carpe Museum
summary: A school trip to the museum turns wild for the Belchers.

title: The Unnatural
summary: Gene loses his confidence after playing badly during a baseball game so Linda sends him to a baseball coach.

title: A River Runs Through Bob
summary: Bob and the family face the great outdoors.

title: Fort Night
summary: Tricks and treats and lunatics abound.

title: Seaplane!
summary: Linda is bored by Bob's tired attempts at Date Night and decides to sign up for flying lessons. When Bob won't join her, she becomes the target of "Upskirt Kurt", the most charming pilot in the air.

title: My Big Fat Greek Bob
summary: Bob scores a temporary gig as a cook at an "underdog" frat house and discovers that he fits right in! Hijinks ensue as Bob and the rest of the fraternity brothers find themselves in the middle of a collegiate prank war that involves the house's most famous alumnus, Dr. Yap. Meanwhile, the kids are on a mission to invade the frat house and get in on the action.

title: Turkey in a Can
summary: Determined to have a perfect Thanksgiving, Bob meticulously prepares the family turkey. But, to his horror, he finds that someone then dumps the turkey in the toilet in an act of Thanksgiving sabotage.

title: Purple Rain-Union
summary: Linda has an upcoming 25 year reunion at Cardinal Gennaro High. Debbie, chairman of the reunion, needs entertainment for the gala. Linda's old band, The Ta Tas, are not even her 3rd choice, but she asks Linda to round up the band: Angie, Patsy, Nancy, and Gayle. Linda does not want to do it: 25 years ago, Bad Hair Day rocked the talent show; and BHD still rocks the pro circuit. The kids egg on Linda until she agrees to perform. Tina plans to babysit, so the kids plan to attend. Like Louise says, who would miss the train wreck of all train wrecks? The kids fail to ...

title: Bob and Deliver
summary: To Tina's delight, Bob becomes the substitute "Home Ec" teacher at her school and ends up creating a full-scale restaurant in the classroom. However, her excitement is short-lived as Bob's position causes father/daughter friction. But when Gene and Louise go to work for Bob's "school" restaurant, Linda must fend for herself at the family's "other" restaurant (aka Bob's Burgers).

title: Christmas in the Car
summary: After spending Christmas Eve outrunning a candy cane truck with their last-minute tree, the Belchers find that Bob's friend gets caught in the kids' Santa trap.

title: Slumber Party
summary: Linda decides to invite some of Louise's classmates over for a slumber party without her knowledge. With the prospect of being forced to endure an entire night with people she hates, Louise devises a plan to get all the girls to beg to go home. With the help of Tina and Gene, she starts to try and scare them off, but one is reluctant to go.

title: Presto-Tina-o
summary: Tina becomes a magician's assistant in order to get closer to Jimmy Jr., while Bob becomes the victim of a magician's "curse."

title: Easy Com-mercial, Easy Go-mercial
summary: To compete with fellow "restaurateur," Jimmy Pesto, and his blowout Super Bowl event, Bob is determined to create a Bob's Burgers commercial to air during the "big game." In an effort to outshine Pesto, the Belchers recruit Randy, a documentarian, to assist with the filmmaking and hire on former pro football star Sandy Frye to be the celebrity endorser.

title: The Frond Files
summary: The Belcher children write fantasy essays about their school that their guidance counselor finds offensive.

title: Mazel Tina
summary: A series of mishaps leave Tina the center of attention at a classmate's Bat Mitzvah she wasn't invited to.

title: Uncle Teddy
summary: Bob and Linda ask Teddy to babysit the kids while they're on a romantic getaway at a Burger Convention. In the process, Teddy earns the title "Uncle Teddy" when he puts Tina's crush in his place for using her to get free burgers.

title: The Kids Rob a Train
summary: Bob, Linda, and the kids board a train for a wine tasting while the kids are put in the caboose. The kids sneak out in an attempt to steal the chocolate from the kitchen car while Bob challenges another person on the train to a contest.

title: I Get Psychic Out of You
summary: Linda is believed to be a psychic when she correctly predicts that a telemarketer is calling the restaurant.

title: The Equestranauts
summary: In an homage to the "Bronies" subculture, Tina attends her first Equestra-con, a convention based on her favorite animated pony show, "The Equestranauts." To her surprise, she finds that the show's fans are middle-aged men (called "Equesticles"). When a powerful super-fan tricks Tina out of her rare toy pony, it's up to Bob to go undercover to get it back.

title: Ambergris
summary: Gene, Louise, and Tina discover a seaweed-covered object at the beach that turns out to be a large hunk of Ambergris - an extremely valuable, but illegal, by-product of whale poop that is used in high-end perfumes. But Louise tries to cheat Gene and Tina out of the profit she hopes to make by selling the treasure on the black market. Meanwhile, Bob and Linda deal with their psychologically unstable landlord who is building them a new bathroom.

title: The Kids Run Away
summary: Louise has a cavity, but also Dentist phobia. The family have to deal with it.

title: Gene It On
summary: Tina tries out for cheerleading, but a spirited and enthusiastic spectator Gene makes more of an impression.

title: Wharf Horse (or How Bob Saves/Destroys the Town - Part I)
summary: Motivated by the promise of a new beachside burger joint, Bob conspires with Felix to convince Mr. Fischoeder to sell Wonder Wharf. Meanwhile, Tina protests the destruction of the wharf's carousel by chaining herself to it.

title: World Wharf II: The Wharfening (or How Bob Saves/Destroys the Town - Part II)
summary: It's Linda and the kids to the rescue when Felix takes desperate measures, and puts Bob and Mr. Fischoeder in danger.

title: Work Hard or Die Trying, Girl
summary: Gene tries to make one of his dreams a reality when he gets the opportunity to make a musical version of Die Hard at the Wagstaff Fall Festival.

title: Tina and the Real Ghost
summary: Tina begins an out-of-this-world romance with a ghost that is believed to be living in the Belcher's basement.

title: Friends with Burger-fits
summary: Bob becomes Teddy's workout buddy after finding out his burgers contributed to Teddy's bad health. The two enroll in a stuntman boot camp where their friendship is put to the test. Meanwhile, the kids make an ice rink in the freezer, with Linda running their underground ice wrestling league.

title: Dawn of the Peck
summary: While Bob is boycotting the holiday, Linda and the kids spend Thanksgiving at the First Annual Fischoeder Turk-tacular Turkey Town Festival. However, a wild bird attack leads to total mayhem.

title: Best Burger
summary: Bob is in a "best burger" competition, but is at risk of losing when an important part of the burger is nowhere to be found.

title: Father of the Bob
summary: At Bob's father's Christmas party, Bob and "Big Bob" rehash an old argument and try to outdo each other in the kitchen. Meanwhile, the kids compete to find the best gift for their dad.

title: Tina Tailor Soldier Spy
summary: After being pestered by the kids and a mistake by Gretchen, Linda decides to dye her hair full blonde. Meanwhile, when trying to quit the Thunder Girls Tina is asked to find a mole in the troop.

title: Midday Run
summary: Tina gets Gene and Louise to help ensure she gets a big hall-monitor promotion.

title: Speakeasy Rider
summary: Tina, Gene and Louise are ready to put the pedal to the metal when they join a go-kart league. Meanwhile, at the restaurant Bob and Teddy partner up to serve Teddy's home-brewed beer.

title: Late Afternoon in the Garden of Bob and Louise
summary: In order to become a member of the community garden, Bob must give Louise's enemy a job.

title: Can't Buy Me Math
summary: Tina and Darryl team up to win the Cupid's Couple contest; Linda plans Valentine's Day activities.

title: The Millie-churian Candiate
summary: Desperate to keep Millie from becoming class president and ruining the school, Tina and Louise volunteer to help run Jimmy Junior's campaign.

title: The Gayle Tales
summary: The kids compete to be their Aunt Gayle's companion for the evening.

title: L'il Hard Dad
summary: Bob becomes obsessed with his new automatic helicopter. When it falls apart for no reason, he enters into a battle with the manufacturer in order to receive a refund. Gene assists Bob in his quest, but things quickly get out of hand and end in a crazy helicopter battle. Meanwhile, Louise and Linda help Tina prepare for her oral book report.

title: Adventures in Chinchilla-sitting
summary: Bob and Linda head out on the town for a date - but to Linda's dismay, Bob's idea of romance proves "trivial." Meanwhile, a wild chinchilla chase ensues after the school pet that Louis was charged with watching escapes out the front door.

title: The Runway Club
summary: The kids try to escape Saturday detention so they can attend the Cotton Candy Festival.

title: Itty Bitty Ditty Committee
summary: Gene is promptly kicked out of the band he formed with Tina, Louise, Rudy, Peter, and Daryl, and proclaims he is never going to play keyboard again.

title: Eat, Spray, Linda
summary: It's Linda's birthday and Bob needs more time to plan her birthday surprise. But when he sends her out of the house as a distraction, she goes missing. Mayhem ensues as the Belchers must work together to find Linda.

title: Housetrap
summary: When a vicious storm strikes during the Belcher family's vacation at a beach house in Craggy Neck, they find themselves staying with the mysterious owner.

title: Hawk & Chick
summary: Bob and Louise are thrilled when they meet Hawk, the star of their favorite martial arts series, and are quick to offer help upon learning about his family troubles.

title: The Oeder Games
summary: With the threat of a rent increase on Ocean Avenue, Bob and the other tenants rebel. After approaching Fischoeder, the tenants find out that they will have to compete in order to convince him to keep their rents reasonable.

title: Sliding Bobs
summary: When Bob starts to lose his hair, Linda reminisces about his mustache and how it made her fall for him; the kids make up their own versions of how Bob and Linda met.

title: The Land Ship
summary: Bob thinks the upcoming Land Ship parade will increase business -- until he learns two porta-potties will be in front of his restaurant; Tina's friends tell her she is boring.

title: The Hauntening
summary: When Louise admits that she has never felt scared before, the family goes to a haunted house in an effort to change but mayhem ensues after their visit.

title: Gayle Makin' Bob Sled
summary: Bob goes to pick up Gayle so she does not miss the Thanksgiving celebration, but gets caught in a snowstorm coming back, leaving Linda to prepare the turkey.

title: Nice-Capades
summary: A grumpy mall Santa threatens to put Gene, Tina and Louise on the naughty list, inspiring them to arrange a musical performance in hopes of changing Santa's mind before Christmas.

title: The Cook, the Steve, the Gayle, & Her Lover
summary: When Bob throws a dinner party, Gayle takes advantage of the opportunity to introduce her new love interest to the family; a long-standing feud is revealed.

title: The Gene and Courtney Show
summary: Gene and Courtney are given the opportunity to be the new hosts of morning announcements, but their romantic history poses challenges; Tina's plan goes awry.

title: Sexy Dance Healing
summary: Bob must take legal action after he slips on the sidewalk and needs to pay for surgery; Jairo promises to heal Bob without doctors; the kids fake a law firm.

title: Sacred Couch
summary: Louise wants the family to get a new couch, but the family votes against it. So she decides to take care of the problem herself.

title: Lice Things Are Lice
summary: When Tina volunteers alongside Nurse Liz, she finds herself involved in the biggest scandal to hit Wagstaff: a lice infestation. Meanwhile, Bob makes improvements to the restaurant that end up driving customers away. Can the Belchers juggle both a crisis at the restaurant and lice?

title: House of 1000 Bounces
summary: The Belcher kids hop into action after news of a bounce house crisis at a birthday party; Bob encounters a guest at the restaurant, fixing him to face a fear.

title: Stand by Gene
summary: When Gene overhears talk about a mystical creature that lives nearby, he leads the Belcher kids and their friends on a journey to find it. Meanwhile, Linda's competitive nature takes over during downtime at the restaurant.

title: Wag the Hog
summary: The Belchers try to help Bob's friend, Critter, after he lands in jail for unpaid parking tickets; Linda takes a job as a babysitter.

title: The Hormone-iums
summary: Tina gets her wish for Wagstaff fame, but soon regrets it. Linda pursues an improbable business venture, but struggles to get it off the ground.

title: Pro Tiki/Con Tiki
summary: Bob's friend Warren comes to visit and makes an offer to invest in the restaurant; Bob is hesitant when he finds out about Warren's interior design ideas.

title: Bye Bye Boo Boo
summary: Louise enters a contest with the hopes that Tina will get to meet Boo Boo from Boyz 4 Now; Bob learns more about the history of the restaurant.

title: The Horse Rider-er
summary: Tina manages to convince her parents to send her to horse camp; but in doing so, she realizes she must end her relationship with her imaginary horse, Jericho.

title: Secret Admiral-irer
summary: Tina's ideas of love and romance are tested when she volunteers at a nursing home to earn her next Thunder Girls badge. Meanwhile, Bob makes new friends who lead him to make some questionable choices.

title: Glued, Where's My Bob?
summary: The Belcher children are involved in a goop war prank that takes place on the same day that a journalist is visiting the restaurant to write a profile.

title: Flu-ouise
summary: Louise comes down with the flu and falls into a wild fever dream filled with familiar faces, zany musical numbers and a crazy adventure.

title: Sea Me Now
summary: Teddy tries to impress his ex-wife by organizing a day trip on his newly refurbished boat; Tina attempts to prove she's responsible enough to have a cellphone by taking care Bob's prized eraser.

title: Teen-a-Witch
summary: When Tammy steals her idea for winning the annual Halloween costume contest, Tina turns to witchcraft.

title: They Serve Horses, Don't They?
summary: The Belchers find themselves involved in a full-blown investigation when Bob secures a new meat provider who claims to save money on every order.

title: Larger Brother, Where Fart Thou?
summary: Gene and Louise are left home alone when Tina ends up in detention, while Bob and Linda get into trouble with their accountant.

title: The Quirk-ducers
summary: The Belcher kids produce their own version of the annual Thanksgiving play and Linda finds a potato that resembles her late grandfather.

title: The Last Gingerbread House on the Left
summary: Bob gets involved in a gingerbread house competition with Mr. Fischoeder and his friends while Linda, Teddy and the kids spread Christmas cheer through caroling.

title: Ex Mach Tina
summary: After hurting her ankle, Tina enrolls in a program that enables her send a robot of herself to school and the robot gives her an unexpected breakthrough with Jimmy Jr.

title: Bob Actually
summary: With Valentine's Day around the corner, the kids find themselves in love-caused chaos and Bob comes up with a romantic gesture to impress Linda.

title: There's No Business Like Mr. Business Business
summary: Bob is skeptical about Gayle's cat Mr. Business having a career in showbiz, until it looks like the cat could have his big break.

title: A Few 'Gurt Men
summary: Louise finds herself in a predicament when she is told that she will be representing one of her biggest enemies at Wagstaff during a mock-trial.

title: Like Gene for Chocolate
summary: Gene learns that the formula for his favorite chocolate has changed, so he works with the head of the company to fix the problem. In the meantime, Bob gets wrapped up in one of Teddy's not-so-perfect plans.

title: The Grand Mama-Pest Hotel
summary: Linda chaperones Tina's weekend at a heroine convention, while Gene and Louise spend the weekend with Bob.

title: Aquaticism
summary: The Belcher kids hatch a plan to save the aquarium from closure, while Bob learns a few things about Linda's customer service skills.

title: Ain't Miss Debatin'
summary: Tina is recruited for the debate team, while Gene and Louise make a stop motion film centered on a surprising subject matter.

title: Eggs for Days
summary: At the annual Easter egg hunt, Bob and Linda have a little too much fun hiding the eggs, so the Belchers race to find the one egg rotting in its hiding place.

title: Zero Larp Thirty
summary: Linda wins a contest to spend a weekend at the home where her favorite TV show is filmed, but it doesn't quite go as planned.

title: The Laser-inth
summary: Bob and Gene go to the last-ever rock-and-roll laser show at the planetarium while Linda and the girls go out to dinner at a wacky restaurant.

title: Thelma & Louise Except Thelma Is Linda
summary: Linda could lose her position as the leader of the Wagstaff bake sale when Louise gets in trouble at school.

title: Mom, Lies and Videotapes
summary: Linda catches a cold just before the Mother's Day show at Wagstaff.

title: Paraders of the Lost Float
summary: Teddy talks Bob into entering the Bog to Beach parade even though the forecast calls for rain.

title: Into the Mild
summary: Bob realizes his dream of being an outdoorsman when the wilderness equipment store has a going out of business sale; Linda and the kids spend the night watching Aunt Gayle rehearse for her one-woman show.

title: Brunchsquatch
summary: Bob decides to serve brunch to compete with Jimmy Pesto; the Belcher kids help Mr. Fischoeder's brother hide from him.

title: The Silence of the Louise
summary: Louise enlists Millie's help to find the culprit who attacked Mr. Frond's therapy dolls.

title: The Wolf of Wharf Street
summary: On Halloween night, Linda tries to impress the kids by taking them to look for a wolf that has been terrorizing the town. Meanwhile, an injured and medicated Bob believes that Teddy has turned into a werewolf.

title: Sit Me Baby One More Time
summary: Tina starts a babysitting franchise that goes off the rails when Tammy is hired to work with her.

title: Thanks-hoarding
summary: The Belchers discover that Teddy is a secret hoarder when they reluctantly agree to pitch in for Thanksgiving with his family.

title: The Bleakening
summary: Linda wants to add some extra cheer to the holidays by throwing a holiday party. After her ornaments are stolen, Linda interrogates her guests. The children think it was "The Bleaken".

title: V for Valentine-detta
summary: Tina has a rough break up on Valentine's Day, so Linda and Louise take her on a girls' night out, while Bob and Gene have a trapeze experience that brings them closer.

title: Y Tu Ga-Ga Tambien
summary: Gene disapproves of a new playground game; Linda fills in for the local library storyteller.

title: The Secret Ceramics Room of Secrets
summary: The kids are tasked with giving their grandma homemade gifts for her birthday and set out to find a secret ceramics room that, according to urban legend, has been boarded up for years.

title: Sleeping with the Frenemy
summary: Tina allows Tammy to stay with the Belchers during Spring Break and fixes her up with a boy from out of town.

title: The Hurt Soccer
summary: The Belchers sign Louise up for a soccer league and must help her train for the last game of the season.

title: Cheer Up Sleepy Gene
summary: Gene is nervous about going to his first sleepover and realizes he had a right to be when things don't go as planned.

title: The Trouble with Doubles
summary: Bob and Linda get trapped in an Escape Room while on a double date with another couple. Meanwhile, Louise hosts a zombie-movie night, but Tina takes charge when the zombies prove to be too scary.

title: Go Tina on the Mountain
summary: Tina befriends a hermit living in the woods when she, Gene and Louise go to Outdoor Education; Bob and Linda see what it's like to be empty-nesters.

title: Are You There Bob? It's Me, Birthday
summary: Linda and the kids try to put together a last-minute surprise party when they forget Bob's birthday, but to do so, Linda asks Hugo to take Bob with him on his restaurant health inspections.

title: Boywatch
summary: Tina joins the Junior Lifeguards, but she struggles with the training, prompting one of her fellow junior guards to try and make her quit.

title: As I Walk Through the Alley of the Shadow of Ramps
summary: Louise gets into a turf war with a juice truck owner trying to set up shop in the Belcher's alley; Linda realizes she can't always come to her sister's defense.

title: Mo Mommy Mo Problems
summary: On Mother's Day, the Belchers wind up in a real estate scheme when attend open houses for free food and Linda meets a charming real estate agent.

title: Mission Impos-Slug-Ble
summary: Louise devises a plan to get her extensive Burobu card collection back after it's confiscated at school.

title: Something Old, Something New, Something Bob Caters for You
summary: The Belchers cater a wedding for a couple who fell in love at the restaurant.

title: Just One of the Boyz 4 Now for Now
summary: Convinced she's met the love of her life, Tina decides to disguise herself as a boy and sneak into the Boyz 4 Now auditions to find him. Back at the restaurant, Teddy asks the rest of the Belcher gang to nurse his baby rat back to health.

title: The Taking of Funtime One Two Three
summary: With help from Mr. Fischoeder, the Belcher kids devise a master plan to win the grand prize dune buggy at their local arcade; Teddy promises Bob and Linda fresh eggs if they take in a chicken.

title: Tweentrepreneurs
summary: Tina, Louise, and Gene get a taste of business when they join the school's Tweentrepeneurs club. Back at the restaurant, Bob and Linda find themselves outsmarted by a dine-and-dasher.

title: Nightmare on Ocean Avenue Street
summary: The Belcher kids set out to find the culprit who's snatching everyone's candy bags on Halloween night. Meanwhile, Teddy gets carried away when he decorates the restaurant to compete with another handyman on the street.

title: Live and Let Fly
summary: The Belcher kids' revenge plan against the school counselor gets them involved in a sibling rivalry between two pilots. Meanwhile Teddy invites Bob and Linda to a paper airplane contest.

title: Bobby Driver
summary: Bob drives a professional quilter around town when she talks him into joining her revenge plot; the kids attend a Gatsby-themed birthday party; Linda helps Teddy expand his taste palate.

title: I Bob Your Pardon
summary: The Belchers try to save a turkey from the slaughterhouse.

title: Roller? I Hardly Know Her!
summary: Gene is upset with his best friend ditching him for Courtney as a roller-dancing partner; Teddy, Linda and Bob discover someone stalking the restaurant.

title: UFO No You Didn't
summary: Tina and her new science partner create a device that allows them to communicate with aliens, but their excitement turns to fear when they receive a dangerous warning message. Meanwhile, Bob attempts to sell mini coat racks he bought.

title: Better Off Sled
summary: The Belcher kids get into a turf war with teenagers who take their usual sledding territory; Bob tries to help Linda knit three scarves before Christmas.

title: Lorenzo's Oil? No, Linda's
summary: Linda's new friend introduces her to essential oils and Aunt Gayle is convinced she must be rescued. Meanwhile, Bob and Teddy are bamboozled into performing a series of annoying favors for Mr. Huggins.

title: The Helen Hunt
summary: The Belchers help Teddy find his dream girl, but Tina believes she's found a better match for him.

title: Bed, Bob & Beyond
summary: A Valentine's Day fight between Bob and Linda has the kids feeling confused. After a failed attempt to see a movie, it's up to Tina, Louise and Gene to tell their own story as a distraction from the awkward tension.

title: Every Which Way but Goose
summary: Tina, discouraged by not being asked to prom by Jimmy Jr., forms an unhealthy attachment to a goose from the nearby park. Meanwhile, Linda joins a dating app to help Gretchen find a match.

title: The Fresh Princ-ipal
summary: Things get out of hand when Louise wins a contest to be Principal for a Day. Meanwhile, Teddy attempts to help Bob when he suddenly finds himself unable to flip burgers.

title: Roamin' Bob-iday
summary: Bob winds up working at a local sandwich shop when the family forces him to take a day off; a last-minute baby shower is thrown for a female biker group.

title: What About Blob?
summary: Gene convinces Tina and Louise to help him save a misunderstood plankton blob from being destroyed by a yacht club.

title: If You Love It So Much, Why Don't You Marionette?
summary: On a school field trip, the kids visit a marionette theater, where Louise gets on the owner's bad side; Bob takes pity on a guy handing out flyers outside the restaurant.

title: Long Time Listener, First Time Bob
summary: The Belchers get in over their heads when they try to help Bob's personal hero, a renegade radio DJ, make a comeback.

title: The Gene Mile
summary: The kids plan to sneak away from a mandatory mile for school on free-ice-cream-day; Bob and Linda try to get discount tickets to a show at the Wharf Arts Center.

title: P.T.A It Ain't So
summary: Linda joins the P.T.A.; Bob tries to cheer up a hardware store owner whose pet parrot flew away.

title: Yes Without My Zeke
summary: The Belcher kids and Jimmy Jr. try to help Zeke when he gets into trouble, but Tina wants Jimmy Jr.'s butt all to herself; Randy rents out Bob's Burgers to shoot an independent short film.

title: The Ring (But Not Scary)
summary: The kids get involved in Bob's plan to surprise Linda for their anniversary.

title: Boys Just Wanna Have Fungus
summary: Bob and Gene try to acquire a rare mushroom for a Burger of the Day; Tina thinks her new prescription glasses have given her a superpower.

title: Motor, She Boat
summary: Bob and Tina participate in a father-daughter cardboard boat race; Linda takes Gene and Louise to a fire station open house.

title: Pig Trouble in Little Tina
summary: Things get spooky when Tina dissects a fetal pig in science class; Bob and Linda battle a giant ball of earwax.

title: Legends of the Mall
summary: On a trip to the mall, Tina is mistaken for someone's girlfriend, Gene and Louise are turned loose on motorized animals, Linda disrupts a book reading and Bob shops for acceptable pants.

title: The Hawkening: Look Who's Hawking Now
summary: Bob and Louise host an exclusive screening of a "Hawk and Chick" movie at the restaurant, but the actor who plays Hawk throws a wrench into their plans for mysterious reasons.

title: Land of the Loft
summary: Bob and Linda attend a loft party on a stormy night while the kids challenge their babysitter and face the storm in an ice cream truck.

title: Now We're Not Cooking with Gas
summary: Bob is willing to do whatever it takes to cook a rare, heritage turkey when the gas goes out on Thanksgiving.

title: All That Gene
summary: Gene auditions for a small role in a local theater production, then discovers that Linda talked the director into giving him the part.

title: Have Yourself a Maily Linda Christmas
summary: Linda works a temp job at the post office to make extra money for the holidays; Bob and Tina get stuck at home with Linda's family; Gene and Louise try to find the perfect gift for Tina.

title: Drumforgiven
summary: Louise comes to Gene's defense when he gets kicked out of the Ocean Avenue Hifi Emporium.

title: A Fish Called Tina
summary: Tina tries too hard to be a perfect mentor; Bob and Linda visit the gym next door.

title: Three Girls and a Little Wharfy
summary: In spite of her skepticism, Louise joins the search for a mythic sea monster; Bob takes a famous chef's online master class.

title: Wag the Song
summary: Tina competes with Gene and Louise to write a new school song for Wagstaff; Jimmy Pesto's new steel awning creates a blinding glare for Bob and Linda.

title: Flat-Top O' the Morning to Ya
summary: Bob and the kids help a down-on-his-luck restaurant owner while Linda and Teddy celebrate St. Patrick's Day.

title: Yurty Rotten Scoundrels
summary: Linda goes to Gayle's artists' workshop in a yurt; Louise and Gene search for a lost cat to collect a cash reward.

title: Just the Trip
summary: The Belchers go on a road trip with Nat the limo driver.

title: Tappy Tappy Tappy Tap Tap Tap
summary: Tina suspects sabotage when Josh gets injured on-stage in a tap show.

title: The Handyman Can
summary: The Belcher kids try to help Teddy when he doubts his abilities as a handyman.

title: Poops!... I Didn't Do It Again
summary: Louise must confront her fear of pooping in public on an overnight school trip to the aquarium; Linda enlists the rest of the family to make a video for her parents' anniversary.

title: Local She-ro
summary: Linda ends up on the trail of a legendary local singer while showing Tina what's great about their town; Teddy asks Bob for help arguing with a sports radio host.

title: Prank You for Being a Friend
summary: Louise gives a classmate lessons on pulling pranks; Bob is reluctant to bring Jimmy Pesto his hernia medication.

title: Dream a Little Bob of Bob
summary: Bob goes on a quest to find a misplaced key to a lock box; Tina tries to learn a hand-slapping song that everyone else can do.

title: Worms of In-Rear-Ment
summary: A pinworm epidemic thwarts Linda's attempt to take the family to the symphony on free admission night.

title: Copa-Bob-Bana
summary: Bob agrees to be the temporary chef at the Fischoeders' new nightclub; the kids throw a pool party in the restaurant basement when they get a hold of a stock tank.

title: Heartbreak Hotel-oween
summary: The kids meet a mysterious old woman at a hotel on Halloween as Louise plots her revenge for a candy transgression; Bob and Linda donate blood at a vampire-themed blood mobile.

title: Fast Time Capsules at Wagstaff School
summary: Tina makes enemies with Tammy when she's put in charge of the Wagstaff School time capsule project; Bob teases Linda for not being able to whistle.

title: Bob Belcher and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Kids
summary: The Belchers try to keep the restaurant open when Bob's flattop breaks on the morning of the Ocean Avenue Business Association's Ocean Fest.

title: Diarrhea of a Poopy Kid
summary: The family tries to cheer up Gene when a stomach flu makes him unable to eat Thanksgiving dinner.

title: The Terminalator II: Terminals of Endearment
summary: When Linda's parents have a layover at a nearby airport, she and Bob decide to make it their annual "visit".

title: Mommy Boy
summary: Gene becomes jealous when Linda joins a women's business group; Louise and Tina want to learn how to fight.

title: Yachty or Nice
summary: Bob wonders if there's a catch to the Belchers being invited to cater the Glencrest Yacht Club's holiday boat parade; Louise has her eye on the Santa Schooner.

title: Romancing the Beef
summary: Louise convinces Bob and Linda to cash in on the Valentine's Day dinner business, forcing them to put their plans on hold; Tina attends Tammy's Anti-Valentine's Day party.

title: Die Card, or Card Trying
summary: Linda drags Bob and the kids into her efforts to take the best family picture ever.

title: An Incon-wheelie-ent Truth
summary: On a trip to the flea market, Bob and Linda are haunted by a lie they told the kids about what happened to their beloved stuffed animal, Wheelie Mammoth.

title: Mr. Lonely Farts
summary: Gene is left home alone when Linda and Tina go to the shoe store, while Bob, Louise and Teddy buy restaurant equipment from a creepy guy Bob found on the internet.

title: Sheshank Redumption
summary: Linda's new diet and exercise routine gives her gastrointestinal disorder on parent-teacher-student conference day.

title: Y Tu Tina También
summary: Tina develops an unexpected crush when she must listen to Spanish audio lessons to improve her grade; Louise and Gene hope to dunk Mr. Frond at the Wagstaff Spring Fair.

title: Fingers-Loose
summary: Tina faces a crisis as hall monitor when she finds a new passion for an underground trend at Wagstaff that Mr. Frond is out to stop; Bob and Linda try to help Teddy sneak food into a movie theater.

title: Some Kind of Fender Benderful
summary: Bob gets into a four-car fender bender outside the restaurant and finding out who's at fault proves to be harder than he thought.

title: Bridge Over Troubled Rudy
summary: Louise ropes Tina and Gene into her journey to see Rudy's model bridge that explodes; Mort tries to teach Bob, Linda and Teddy how to meditate.

title: Steal Magazine-olias
summary: The Belcher kids get into a cat-and-mouse game with Dr. Yap when he catches them stealing something in the waiting room of his office; Bob, Linda and Teddy try to clean bird poop off the restaurant window.

title: Tell Me Dumb Thing Good
summary: Linda recruits the kids in her fight to save a dumb local tradition; Bob is entranced by an online cucumber.

title: Vampire Disco Death Dance
summary: Tina invites her friends to see an old campy vampire sing-along movie with her and Bob; Linda opens a restaurant for raccoons in the alley.

title: Manic Pixie Crap Show
summary: Louise must attend the Pixie Princess Promenade to pay Millie a debt; a bouquet shaped like a dog forces Linda to face her past.

title: Crystal Mess
summary: When Tina gets nervous about an oral report, Mr. Frond lends her a crystal his girlfriend claims has special powers; Bob and Linda purchase a box of imperfect produce and try to use it all before it goes bad.

title: The Pumpkinening
summary: Linda receives a mysterious note on Halloween and must go to her old hometown with Gayle to answer for a misdeed they committed 27 years ago.

title: Driving Big Dummy
summary: Bob goes on a road trip with Teddy; Linda and the kids compete to be Employee of the Day.

title: Seven-tween Again
summary: Gene freaks out about growing up and tries to stay young; Linda considers trying the new hair salon next to the restaurant, but fears the wrath of her hairdresser-slash-friend Gretchen.

title: Beach, Please
summary: Louise and Mr. Fischoeder engage in a battle of wits when the Belcher kids take part in a beach clean-up for Wagstaff Volunteer Day; Teddy surprises Bob and Linda with his new look.

title: Loft in Bedslation
summary: Linda and Tina try to help Louise build a bed loft in one day; Bob and Gene host a tabletop role-playing game.

title: Stuck in the Kitchen with You
summary: Louise gets stuck helping Bob cook Thanksgiving dinner for a retirement home; Tina and Gene assist Zeke with entertaining the residents.

title: FOMO You Didn't
summary: Tina becomes obsessed with her schoolmates ditching class during a photography assignment; the Belchers are visited by a woman who used to live in their apartment.

title: Gene's Christmas Break
summary: Gene breaks an extremely rare Christmas record from the '70s, so he and his sisters search for another copy; Teddy tries to do a neighborhood Secret Santa with Bob and Linda.

title: Touch of Eval(uations)
summary: Louise discovers that Mr. Frond's plan to have the students evaluate the teachers shifts the balance of power from the teachers to the children; Bob and Linda can't agree on their final resting place.

title: Ferry on My Wayward Bob and Linda
summary: Bob and Linda are invited to a Valentine's Day dinner at a fancy restaurant on Kingshead Island; the kids attempt to get past Jen the babysitter so they can have cheap Valentine's Day candy.

title: Frigate Me Knot
summary: Teddy is forced to face his past when Linda encourages him to attend a farewell ceremony for the ship on which he served in the Navy.

title: Video Killed the Gene-io Star
summary: Gene reluctantly agrees to star in a music video for Courtney; Teddy and Linda are obsessed with a mysterious customer at the restaurant.

title: Ancient Misbehavin
summary: Louise, Millie, and Rudy plot revenge on a teacher after feeling slighted during a special Ancient Greece unit; Bob gets his own room.

title: Interview with a Pop-pop-pire
summary: The Belchers tell their own versions of an infamous tree incident in the early years of Big Bob as they await his arrival so Tina can interview him for a school project during dinner.

title: The Spider House Rules
summary: Louise hides a house spider in her room after being told to get rid of it; Bob tries to make a friend outside of the people who come to the restaurant.

title: Clear and Present Ginger
summary: Linda plans a big day for her friend Ginger's visit; Bob and the kids help Nat with a limo competition.

title: A-Sprout a Boy
summary: Gene becomes obsessed with an old handheld game, so Bob offers to help him with a school project in the hope of steering him towards more interesting pursuits; Louise and Tina take over a grocery store kiddie ride.

title: Sauce Side Story
summary: Louise, Gene and Tina must navigate an old family feud when they attempt to find a lost family recipe for a Mother's Day gift for Linda.

title: Some Like It Bot Part 1: Eighth Grade Runner
summary: After Tammy and Jocelyn ridicule her new shirt, Tina turns to her erotic friend-fiction and writes about a futuristic world where she's a robot.

title: Some Like It Bot Part 2: Judge-bot Day
summary: Tina embarks on a mission that could get her into trouble and the family tries to stop her when they read her erotic friend fiction.
